column12: Heat exchanger and method of making the same
column13: A method for forming a heat exchanger is disclosed. The method includes the steps of forming a plurality of generally planar plate members from a sheet of material, each of the plate members being connected to an adjacent plate member by a deformable link. The method further includes forming a plurality of tube members by folding the plurality of plate members at the deformable links, inserting a fin member between adjacent tube members, and compressing the plurality of tube members and fin members under a predetermined load to form a heat exchanger core. The method also includes the steps of bending the folded deformable links against the core and brazing the core at a predetermined temperature. A heat exchanger manufactured according to this method is also disclosed.
column15: SCHORNHORST CARL ECKARDT;;SELM GERALD JOSEPH;;WISE KEVIN BENNETT
column16: VISTEON GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES INC (2000-06-15);;FORD MOTOR COMPANY (1997-12-17);;HANON SYSTEMS (2013-07-26)

column12: Heat exchanger and method of making the same
column13: A method of making a heat exchanger, comprising the steps of: providing a sheet (24) of deformable material; forming a plurality of generally planar plate members (26) from the sheet of material, each of the plate members being connected to an adjacent plate member by a deformable link (27,29); forming a plurality of tube members (12) by folding the plurality of plate members (26) at the deformable links so that adjacent plate members form a tube member; inserting a fin member (14) between adjacent tube members; compressing the plurality of tube members (12) and fin members under a predetermined load to form a heat exchanger core (10), including forming a plurality of folded deformable links (70,72) projecting outwardly from the core; bending the folded deformable links (70,72) against the core; and brazing the core (10) at a predetermined temperature. The present invention also provides a heat exchanger manufactured according to the above method.
column15: SELM GERALD JOSEPH;;WISE KEVIN BENNETT;;SCHORNHORST CARL ECKARDT
column16: HALLA VISTEON CLIMATE CONTROL CORPORATION, KR (2013-09-26)
column32: PATENT ABSTRACTS OF JAPAN vol. 013, no. 143 (M - 811) 7 April 1989 (1989-04-07);;PATENT ABSTRACTS OF JAPAN vol. 012, no. 055 (M - 669) 19 February 1988 (1988-02-19)

column13: A machine for bending a first set and a second set of folded deformable links projecting outwardly from a heat exchanger core made is disclosed. The machine comprises a base, a transport mechanism for transporting the core to a workstation, a locking mechanism for locking the core in a predetermined orientation in the workstation, and a bending mechanism attached to the base for bending a set of folded deformable links against the core.

column12: Method for transporting heat exchanger fins and forming a heat exchanger core subassembly
column13: A method for transporting heat exchanger fins and forming a core subassembly for a heat exchanger uses a universal fin tray for all subassemblies instead of different tray sizes for different core subassemblies. The method includes indexing core plates forward under a stationary fin stuffing box, loading fins into the universal fin tray, indexing the loaded fins forward one at a time corresponding to the number of fins required, pushing required fins into the fin stuffing box when indexing reaches number required for the core subassembly, and pushing fins out of the fin stuffing box into the plates forming the core subassembly. A universal fin tray size, a stationary fin box, and a stationary cut off are used for all core sizes.
column15: SELM GERALD JOSEPH;;WISE KEVIN BENNETT;;SCHORNHORST CARL ECKARDT
column16: VISTEON GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES INC (2000-06-15);;FORD MOTOR COMPANY (1999-05-04)

column12: HEAT EXCHANGER CORE METHOD AND APPARATUS
column13: A machine and method for corrugating preformed plates that form the core element (50) of a heat exchanger (10). A fold forming mechanism (112) imparts an initial fold in the deformable links (28, 30) joining a series of preformed plates received from an external source. A gathering mechanism (132, 134) gathers the folded series of preformed plates to produce a flow of pairs of mating plates (140). Precut lengths of corrugated fins (45) are then inserted between joined adjacent pairs of mating plates (140) and a cut-off mechanism (156) severs the deformable links (28, 30) of preselected pairs of links joining pairs of mating plates to separate individual core elements (50) from the flow of plates (40).
column14: LIVERNOIS RES & DEV CO;;FORD MOTOR CO

column12: Corrugation machine for making a core for a heat exchanger
column13: A machine for corrugating preformed plates that form the core element of a heat exchanger. A fold forming mechanism imparts an initial fold in the deformable links joining a series of preformed plates received from an external source. A gathering mechanism gathers the folded series of preformed plates to produce a flow of pairs of mating plates. Precut lengths of corrugated fins are then inserted between joined adjacent pairs of mating plates and a cut-off mechanism severs the deformable links of preselected pairs of links joining pairs of mating plates to separate individual core elements from the flow of plates.
column14: LIVERNOIS RES & DEV CO;;FORD MOTOR CO

column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Wischblatt insbesondere Flachwischblatt für ein Fahrzeug, zur Anordnung an einen antreibbaren Wischarm, mit wenigstens einem langgestreckten, aus einem flexiblen Material bestehenden Trageelement, mit einem an dem Trageelement anlegbaren Wischgummi, das eine der zu wischenden Scheibe zugewandte Wischleiste umfasst, und mit an den freien Enden des Wischgummis bzw. des Trageelements angeordneten Endelementen. DOLLAR A Die Erfindung kennzeichnet sich dadurch, dass wenigstens ein Endelement ein Strömungsprofil aufweist, durch welches das Wischblatt bei Anströmung durch den Fahrtwind während des Wischvorganges mit einer erhöhten Anpresskraft gegen die Scheibe gedrückt wird.
column15: SCHMID ECKARDT;;LENZEN OLIVER;;EGNER-WALTER BRUNO;;PACHUR GERALD;;SCHAEUBLE MICHAEL

column12: Automatic fin rotation apparatus for a heat exchanger
column13: An apparatus for selectively orienting consecutive fin strips relative to one another as a preliminary step in the manufacture of a heat exchanger includes a sensor for sensing the presence of each of a series of fin strips all having a common orientation relative to one another. The apparatus includes an orienting member which receives signals from the sensor as to the presence of each fin strip and rotates each consecutive fin strips in alternating clockwise and counter-clockwise directions to orient consecutive fin strips 180.degree. relative to each adjacent fin strip.

column15: SCHORNHORST CARL ECKARDT;;MEHRABAN HENRY;;SELM GERALD JOSEPH;;LUTTERMOSER ROBERT RAYMOND;;SEXTON JERRY LEE

column12: System and method for developing reusable flexible and platform independent software using components
column13: Re-use and platform independence of application software is achieved by using component types comprising an interface and a body. This is followed by automatically generating components based on the developed component types. The development process steps are preceded by an adaptation process step, during which the functionality of all component types is defined for all the platforms.
column15: ECKARDT DIETER;;AMLER GERALD;;DOHT HANS-CHRISTIAN;;SCHORRIG HARTMUT;;HACKL FRANZ;;KUGLER REINHOLD;;RENNER KLAUS-DIETER;;MUELLER MANFRED

column12: SOFTWARE SYSTEM AND ITS DEVELOPING METHOD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To solve problems such as extreme difficulty in transplanting software to a platform different from the initial calculation purpose of that software, the necessity of further tests and increase in the total cost of transplantation for changing that software and transplanting it to the other platform. SOLUTION: The recyclability and platform independence of application software are achieved by using a component type composed of interface and body. Afterwards, a component is automatically generated based on the developed component type thereof. Before the development process stage thereof, there is an adaptive process stage and during this adaptive process stage, the functions of all component types are defined to all platforms.
column15: AMLER GERALD;;DOHT HANS-CHRISTIAN;;ECKARDT DIETER;;HACKL FRANZ;;KUGLER REINHOLD;;MUELLER MANFRED DR;;RENNER KLAUS-DIETER;;SCHORRIG HARTMUT
